info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 1 at 2:37AM EDT until August 1 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey, including the following county, Cumberland.
* WHEN...Until 345 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 236 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated flooding due to an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Parsonage Run COHANSEY-MAURICE, Barrett Run COHANSEY-MAURICE, Cohansey River COHANSEY-MAURICE and Cornwell Run COHANSEY- MAURICE. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - For Cohansey River at Seeley: At 2:15am the stage was 6.19 feet. Flood Stage is 6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING
